title: New animation: Geeks In Love!
content:
[url=http://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/295165]GEEKS IN LOVE[/url]

Music by Lemon Demon; animation by TmsT.

Swim, swim, hungry. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lindsey.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: New animation: Geeks In Love!
content:
Hahaha, that's awesome! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]
It's valentine day tomorrow?

Edit: Cool, you have Doc Emmett Brown from BTTF there in those small pictures! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I always go through your Flash animations with pause (in case there is pause) if there's those quickly flashing pictures involved. Again plenty of cool stuff, I wish you'd make browsing them easier sometime, perhaps making something gallery section. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]
Another edit: Wow, there's big picture of Doc and Clara Clayton! Didn't notice it first! Cool!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: hum
content:
Yes well I was animating for Lemon Demon before they were famous for TEH ULTEMATE SHODOWN, which people keep emailing me about and congratulating me on (morons!). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

While I have nothing to do with the actual creation of Lemon Demon songs (which are all composed and recorded by Neil Cicierega, sometimes with his friend and neighbour Alora Lanzilotta helping out when he performs live in cafes), I have known Neil since I got into animutation circles in around 2003-2004. When I heard his music, I just had to turn some of those songs into music videos. And I still am doing so to this very day! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

content:
haha TMST check this out...

So I was chatting with my friend online and she links me to Geeks In Love and says "This is totally me and andy" (who is her boyfriend). So I click it and I'm like.... "oh yeah, I kinda know the guy who made this video. We've talked before." and she shat herself. hahaha it was pretty sweet.[img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]

An, um, any chance of making a Commander Keen aniimation? Or, have you already done it and I haven't seen it (shame on me)?___________________

title: Re: ;)
content: DaVince, if you go here, [url=http://dosclassics.com/downloads.php?cat=0&subcat=7]dosclassics.com/downloads...0&subcat=7[/url] you can find the "Shadowlands" series.  Ilsoap did the 1st two videos, but Too Much Spare Time made the third!  Check them out.[img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]

title: Re: ;)
content: WHAT!?!? A third? YIPPEEEEEE!!!!![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v426/RoboRed/RoboredSig2.jpg[/img]

title: Re: ;)
content:
Yeah, it's nice to be able to say that we've been following TMST's stuff since before he became a world-renowned flash artist. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

I've been saying it here and there for a while now, but Andrew and Neil are two of the best creative talents on the internet. Together, the results have yet to be anything short of amazing. Easily one of your best works, in terms of animation/graphical quality and visual design. Match that with one of the top tier LD songs and this is an instant win.

title: Re: ;)
content:
That animation was funny to see.
Lots of people on the internet can identify with geeks, I'd assume, so it's probably a good subject too. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

It's sort of funny, because I remember Trapezoid, from back in the SCRAMM days.
I only recently realised who he'd become after Googling for SCRAMM to see if I could find out whatever happened to it now (nothing specific earlier), and found a post by Squinky about SCRAMM, and Trapezoid... Neal.

It seems I know 2 famous Flash animation artists now.
A winner is me!
Well, I suppose I'd need to be an animator myself to actually be, but whatever.

In conclusion, because I feel like having one:
I should watch Flash animations more often.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
